title: Synthetic Recap
body:
CHARLOTTE, N.C. – On a night where the scoreboard read like a one-man show, Glen Rice authored a performance for the ages, single-handedly carrying the Charlotte Hornets to a 102-97 victory over the Toronto Raptors.

Rice wasn't just a scorer; he was an unstoppable force of nature, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 56 points. From the opening tip, he was in an incandescent rhythm, hitting from every conceivable spot on the floor. The Raptors tried every defender in their arsenal, but no one could slow the torrent of points. Rice’s historic outburst, an exceptionally high watermark that dwarfed all other contributions, was the entire narrative of the game.

While Rice’s spectacular shooting line—a blistering display of efficiency—provided the firepower, the victory was sealed by a complete team effort in the final moments. With the game on the line, it was David Wesley who stepped up, first with a crucial driving layup and then by coolly sinking two free throws to ice the game. His 19 points and 10 assists were the perfect complement to Rice’s explosion.

For Toronto, the valiant effort of Walt Williams, who tallied 24 points, was ultimately drowned out by the Rice onslaught. The Raptors fought hard but had no answer for history in the making.

In the end, the box score will forever show Glen Rice’s 56 points, a monumental individual achievement that carved a path to a hard-fought team win. It was a night where one man’s brilliance became the story, the strategy, and the reason for victory.
